text: Hi Jon, I hope you are doing great. I would like to know that if I can add line height in typography section at theme options or let me know if any alternative.

you can add any theme fields you want of the types listed here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes#fields-json>

What they control is completely up to you.

For line-height a number field would be appropriate

Hi everyone! I’ve seen this asked a couple of times in the past, but haven’t seen any responses within the last 2 years. Is it possible to populate a choice field’s options with content from HubDB within a custom module?
Not within a custom module, no. A choice tag in a page template though, that is possible.
Thanks Mark. Not what I was hoping to hear, but what I assumed was the case.

We have a request from a client who wants to stream their own blog posts into different HubSpot portals for their clients.  So requirements are:
• blog posts are generated from RSS feed
• Featured images are imported as part of the process
Not sure if this is the right approach but thought I would start here.  Thanks!
You should be able to use a rss_listing hubl tag with the source blogs RSS feed URL. Just know that even though you're using hubl, the posts still will need to render client-side
<@U26BLKGE4> we are trying to ballpark the scope and solution.  What do you mean render client-side?

Just a technical consideration; means you lose some of the serverside optimizations that HubSpot has when referencing objects (like blogs or hubdb tables) that are in the same portal. Rather, the blog content will be rendered as an extra step after the initial page load.
